message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "The study combines survey data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and fiscal data from the International Monetary Fund's Government Finance Statistics database.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "International Monetary Fund's Government Finance Statistics"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "In this analysis, we utilize micro-data from household surveys conducted by the National Bureau of Statistics of Nigeria in 2010 and 2020.", "dataset": ["household surveys conducted by the National Bureau of Statistics of Nigeria"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This research draws on monthly data on electricity consumption obtained from Kenya Power and Lighting Company and time-series data on rainfall and temperature from the Climate Research Unit at the University of East Anglia.", "dataset": ["Kenya Power and Lighting Company", "Climate Research Unit at the University of East Anglia"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use longitudinal data from the Millennium Cohort Study and the Longitudinal Survey of Young People in England to estimate the causal link between maternal smoking during pregnancy and cognitive development of children.", "dataset": ["Millennium Cohort Study", "Longitudinal Survey of Young People in England"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This article presents evidence from a range of datasets including the Global Financial Inclusion Database and the Demographic and Health Surveys to examine the relationship between women's empowerment and financial inclusion.", "dataset": ["Global Financial Inclusion Database", "Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Gender", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we analyze data from the National Education Longitudinal Survey and the Early Childhood Longitudinal Study to investigate the effects of preschool attendance on educational outcomes of children.", "dataset": ["National Education Longitudinal Survey", "Early Childhood Longitudinal Study"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "We use household survey data from the Living Standards Measurement Study and rain gauge data from the Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission to analyze the impact of climate shocks on household welfare in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study", "Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This study employs a combination of satellite remote sensing data from Landsat and Sentinel-2 and field survey data to map and estimate aboveground biomass in tropical forests.", "dataset": ["Landsat", "Sentinel-2"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "To examine the effect of political instability on financial development, we use panel data from World Development Indicators and the Political Risk Services Group's International Country Risk Guide.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "Political Risk Services Group's International Country Risk Guide"], "topic": ["Governance", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "We exploit variation in exposure to agitation of the civil war in Sierra Leone and use micro-data from the Demographic Health Survey and Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey to investigate the effect of prenatal exposure to stress on child health and survival.", "dataset": ["Demographic Health Survey", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence", "Health"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "The study combines survey data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and fiscal data from the International Monetary Fund's Government Finance Statistics database.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "International Monetary Fund's Government Finance Statistics"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "In this analysis, we utilize micro-data from household surveys conducted by the National Bureau of Statistics of Nigeria in 2010 and 2020.", "dataset": ["household surveys conducted by the National Bureau of Statistics of Nigeria"], "topic": pregnancy and cognitive development of children.", "dataset": ["Millennium Cohort Study", "Longitudinal Survey of Young People in England"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This article presents evidence from a range of datasets including the Global Financial Inclusion Database and the Demographic and Health Surveys to examine the relationship between women's empowerment and financial inclusion.", "dataset": ["Global Financial Inclusion Database", "Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Gender", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we analyze data from the National Education Longitudinal Survey and the Early Childhood Longitudinal Study to investigate the effects of preschool attendance on educational outcomes of children.", "dataset": ["National Education Longitudinal Survey", "Early Childhood Longitudinal Study"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "We use household survey data from the Living Standards Measurement Study and rain gauge data from the Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission to analyze the impact of climate shocks on household welfare in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study", "Tropical Rainfall Measuring Mission"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This study employs a combination of satellite remote sensing data from Landsat and Sentinel-2 and field survey data to map and estimate aboveground biomass in tropical forests.", "dataset": ["Landsat", "Sentinel-2"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "To examine the effect of political instability on financial development, we use panel data from World Development Indicators and the Political Risk Services Group's International Country Risk Guide.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "Political Risk Services Group's International Country Risk Guide"], "topic": ["Governance", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "We exploit variation in exposure to agitation of the civil war in Sierra Leone and use micro-data from the Demographic Health Survey and Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey to investigate the effect of prenatal exposure to stress on child health and survival.", "dataset": ["Demographic Health Survey", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence", "Health"]}]
